verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Introduction of God's address to Moses. Follows standard formula in Exodus.

verses.text: "See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.comment: Bezalel is designated as the chosen craftsman. Name structure as in the original.

verses.text: And I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge, and with all kinds of craftsmanship,
verses.comment: The Spirit of God is understood as divine empowerment for skilled work.

verses.text: to create artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.comment: Crafts include metalwork and artistic design as specified for the tabernacle.

verses.text: in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, to work in all kinds of craftsmanship.
verses.comment: Continues listing different crafts; 'cutting stones for setting' refers to gemstone work.

verses.text: And I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan. And I have given skill to all the craftsmen, so that they may make everything I have commanded you:
verses.comment: Lists Oholiab as co-leader; acknowledges broader group of craftsmen.

verses.text: the tent of meeting, the ark of the testimony, the mercy seat that is on it, and all the furnishings of the tent,
verses.comment: Refers specifically to the tabernacle and its key items.

verses.text: the table and its utensils, the pure lampstand with all its utensils, the altar of incense,
the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, the basin and its stand,
verses.comment: Continues listing key items for worship.

verses.text: the finely woven garments—the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, for their service as priests,
verses.comment: 'Finely woven' reflects the meaning of 'woven' and 'of skill.'

verses.text: the anointing oil and the fragrant incense for the Holy Place. They must do all that I have commanded you."
verses.comment: Concludes the list of objects and materials.

verses.text: And the LORD said to Moses,

"Speak also to the Israelites, saying: 'You must surely keep my Sabbaths, for this is a sign between me and you throughout your generations, so that you may know that I am the LORD who sanctifies you.
verses.comment: 'You must surely keep' translates an emphatic Hebrew construction.

verses.text: Therefore you must keep the Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it must surely be put to death, for whoever does any work on it—that person must be cut off from among his people.
verses.comment: Literal translation of severe penalty; 'cut off' can mean excommunication or execution.

verses.text: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest, holy to the LORD. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day must surely be put to death.
Therefore the Israelites must keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their generations as a covenant forever.
verses.comment: Covenant aspect of Sabbath is emphasized.

verses.text: It is a sign forever between me and the Israelites. For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, but on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed."
verses.comment: 'Was refreshed' is a literal translation of 'took a breath.'

verses.text: When he finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, he gave Moses the two tablets of the testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
verses.comment: 'Finger of God' is a literal and traditional rendering.
